comment: Smart Data Models - SynchronousMachineTimeConstantReactance adapted to DTDL from smartdatamodels.org. Source: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/smart-data-models/dataModel.EnergyCIM/master/SynchronousMachineTimeConstantReactance/schema.json
description: Adapted from CIM data models. Synchronous machine detailed modelling types are defined by the combination of the attributes SynchronousMachineTimeConstantReactance.modelType and SynchronousMachineTimeConstantReactance.rotorType.     The parameters used for models expressed in time constant reactance form include:

contents.name: alternateName
contents.comment: An alternative name for this item

contents.name: areaServed
contents.comment: The geographic area where a service or offered item is provided

contents.name: dataProvider
contents.comment: A sequence of characters identifying the provider of the harmonised data entity.

contents.name: dateCreated
contents.comment: Entity creation timestamp. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.

contents.name: dateModified
contents.comment: Timestamp of the last modification of the entity. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.

contents.name: description
contents.comment: A description of this item

contents.name: ks
contents.comment: Saturation loading correction factor (Ks) (>= 0).  Used only by Type J model.  Typical Value = 0. Default: 0.0

contents.name: modelType
contents.comment: Type of synchronous machine model used in Dynamic simulation applications. Default: None

contents.name: name
contents.comment: The name of this item.

contents.name: rotorType
contents.comment: Type of rotor on physical machine. Default: None

contents.name: source
contents.comment: A sequence of characters giving the original source of the entity data as a URL. Recommended to be the fully qualified domain name of the source provider, or the URL to the source object.

contents.name: tc
contents.comment: Damping time constant for `Canay` reactance.  Typical Value = 0. Default: 0

contents.name: tpdo
contents.comment: Direct-axis transient rotor time constant (T`do) (> T``do).  Typical Value = 5. Default: 0

contents.name: tppdo
contents.comment: Direct-axis subtransient rotor time constant (T``do) (> 0).  Typical Value = 0.03. Default: 0

contents.name: tppqo
contents.comment: Quadrature-axis subtransient rotor time constant (T``qo) (> 0). Typical Value = 0.03. Default: 0

contents.name: tpqo
contents.comment: Quadrature-axis transient rotor time constant (T`qo) (> T``qo). Typical Value = 0.5. Default: 0

contents.name: xDirectSubtrans
contents.comment: Direct-axis subtransient reactance (unsaturated) (X``d) (> Xl).  Typical Value = 0.2. Default: 0.0

contents.name: xDirectSync
contents.comment: Direct-axis synchronous reactance (Xd) (>= X`d). The quotient of a sustained value of that AC component of armature voltage that is produced by the total direct-axis flux due to direct-axis armature current and the value of the AC component of this current, the machine running at rated speed. Typical Value = 1.8. Default: 0.0

contents.name: xDirectTrans
contents.comment: Direct-axis transient reactance (unsaturated) (X`d) (> =X``d).  Typical Value = 0.5. Default: 0.0

contents.name: xQuadSubtrans
contents.comment: Quadrature-axis subtransient reactance (X``q) (> Xl).  Typical Value = 0.2. Default: 0.0

contents.name: xQuadSync
contents.comment: Quadrature-axis synchronous reactance (Xq) (> =X`q). The ratio of the component of reactive armature voltage, due to the quadrature-axis component of armature current, to this component of current, under steady state conditions and at rated frequency.  Typical Value = 1.6. Default: 0.0

contents.name: xQuadTrans
contents.comment: Quadrature-axis transient reactance (X`q) (> =X``q).  Typical Value = 0.3. Default: 0.0

contents.name: owner
contents.comment: A List containing a JSON encoded sequence of characters referencing the unique Ids of the owner(s)

contents.name: address
contents.comment: The mailing address
